pullrequest.title: [Blueprint] Bundle scene updates in sensor system

content.raw: as explained in person, a dip in RTF is observed at the timestep in which the sensor update happens. For the world linked in the description, the camera updates happen at 30Hz so that’s how often the dip occurs. The performance improvement “reduces the dip”, i.e. reduces the time taken to perform sensors update for that frame. The average RTF may be improved slightly but it’s hard to tell by looking at the RTF reported in the GUI since that’s averaged over a window size of 20 timesteps. If the cameras have a higher framerate,  the performance improvement would be more noticeable.
content.html: as explained in person, a dip in RTF is observed at the timestep in which the sensor update happens. For the world linked in the description, the camera updates happen at 30Hz so that’s how often the dip occurs. The performance improvement “reduces the dip”, i.e. reduces the time taken to perform sensors update for that frame. The average RTF may be improved slightly but it’s hard to tell by looking at the RTF reported in the GUI since that’s averaged over a window size of 20 timesteps. If the cameras have a higher framerate, the performance improvement would be more noticeable.
